data.title: Neat place, disappointed in the food
data.text:
The restaurant is located in the alley between the Haberfelde Building and the 18th street parking garage.  I really liked the entrance and bar area.  In fact, I think the bar and bartender is the best thing about this place!  Great drinks and very attentive service from the bartender.  

Once seated, we were waited on right away and our waitress was great.  However, once our food came, it was pretty 'eh.'  Especially for the price.  I had the Gorgonzola Balsamic Filet,  there was so much sauce on the plate that not only was the steak overpowered by the balsamic, but the baked potato tasted like balsamic AND the veggies tasted like balsamic.  EVERYTHING tasted the same.  It was pretty awful.  My husband had a rib eye (I think, could have been a NY) that was in a red wine reduction looking sauce and there was a ton of sauce on his plate as well.  For the price, my husband said his steak was just ok.  Our waitress could tell I didn't like my dish and I explained that the vegetables and baked potato really soaked up the balsamic and she replied something to the effect that they've had that complaint before.

We really wanted to try one of their desserts because we heard they're fantastic, but our waitress just brought our check, so we paid and left.  

I'd like to give this place another shot, but at this price point I don't think we will.  Will definitely be stopping in for a drink though!

data.title: Quality Dining Experience
data.text: This is one of best restaurants in Bakersfield.  It is quality dining with the tab to go with it.  It is great of that special occasion.

data.title: The best hidden treasure I've found
data.text: My husband, sister-in-law, her husband, and myself, all went for dinner and it was absolutely amazing!! It took awhile to get served, but the waitress was very apologetic and from that moment on was there for us. I ordered a "danish" chicken dish (the names a bit difficult to remember) but it was to die for! My husband and brother-in-law ordered the prime rib...very delicious. My sister-in-law ordered the ny steak, delicious as well. Everything was great!! Definitely will return.

data.title: Nice and Romantic
data.text: If you want to be spoiled this is the place. This is a hide a way place in the heart of downtown. maybe a little hard to find but once you do it is real worth it. great steaks and gourmet food. and leave room for dessert here just wonderful. Great Cheers style bar if you just want drinks and dessert.

data.title: Great atmosphere/wonderful food
data.text: This place is located in an old building downtown and was once a speak-easy. It' has a beautiful old bar, and the atmosphere is old world nice. The food is great. Some of the best meats and sauces. The wine list used to be more extensive, but what they have is adequate.

data.title: Always feel welcome and appreciated
data.text: My wife and I have been to TL Maxwell's 4 times so far and every time the food was outstanding. The place has a very warm old school feel. Terry the owner greeted us each time and though I know he probably doesn't know us by name he certainly recognized us. He truly embodies the local small business owner. Very friendly and accommodating. We left feeling as though we were in a familiar place that felt good to spend our money in. Everything is fresh and cooked very well. Can't say enough. This place is a Bakersfield gem and a must dine location.

data.title: Who knew they did banquets
data.text:
We have been to Maxwell's before, and always had a great experience, both food and service are always top notch, so when a group I belong to arranged a banquet there I was looking forward to it.  
As I expected from past visits, the food and service were excellent.  Most of the people at our table, including the wife, and I, had steak, there also was salmon and a chicken dish that I saw, and heard good things about.  Now most people like their steak medium-rare, but having cooked for large groups, and been to many banquets it is next to impossible to get en mass servings of steak that aren't medium or more, in fact most places don't even try.  To my surprise every steak that I saw was absolutely medium-rare, and they were pretty thin, so that is almost a miracle. Besides the steak everything was typical Maxwell's quality, I heard nothing but praise from the entire group about the food.  The only minor complaints were that the room is pretty stark, white walls, almost no decoration, just basically a big dining room.  Also, and this was our fault, there were too many people crammed into the space, which made it even more amazing that the wait staff were able to give such good service in such a crowded room.
Bottom line is I don't see Maxwell's as just a great place to go for dinner, they also put on a great group experience.

data.title: Terrific restaurant
data.text: Maxwell's is always a treat - it is a 'cut above the rest' and always provide's an excellent dining experience from the cuisine to the service.  It is definitely a 5 star dining opportunity in Bakersfield.

data.title: Upscale Food and Funky, Historic Decor
data.text:
T. L. Maxwell’s has a very unassuming exterior. It is located on more of an alley than a street, so  I wondered whether I had found the right place. Even when I entered, the cavernous bar area with its funky decor was like entering a speakeasy from the 50’s. Indeed, the place had been a speakeasy at one point!

The main dining area is much nicer than the bar area, and quiet as well. I can see why locals find Maxwell’s a great place for special occasions. You can have a romantic conversation without shouting.

The prices are in the fine dining category. Fortunately the food lives up to the pricing. The rack of lamb was perfectly cooked. I haven’t had a fully loaded baked potato as good as this one in years. I was impressed that the wine list had some interesting by-the-glass choices, including Justin, which is one of my favorites.

Service was wonderful.

data.title: Expensive but worth it
data.text: I go to TL Maxwell's on special occasions because I could go broke eating there all the time.  The food is excellent and unique. The deserts especially are worth the trip just by themselves. The atmosphere reminds me of an old men's club with lots of wood and an upper class feel. On my first visit I asked to see the old speak easy and was escorted to the former gambling area that was one of the places connected by tunnels under Bakersfield.  It has a hint of the bad boy club where movie moguls or mobsters might have once gone when the wanted great food in a classy joint.

data.title: Always a good meal and atmosphere.
data.text: We had a wonderful dinner and time. TL Maxwells is our place to go to impress our out of town gusts.  Our meals there have always been top notched. The restaurant is filled with a rich history. It's nice to arrive there a little early and have a drink at the bar where many past dignitaries have stopped by for a refreshing drink and meet up with friends. The restaurant is not very big and has a very comfortable feel. The waitress was very attentive.

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: The restaurant had been well hyped and didn't live up to the tales.  I prefer some flavor and spice in my food and didn't find it here.

data.title: Worth a visit
data.text:
You should give Maxwell's a try, they deserve it as they have been a downtown mainstay during good times and bad and they are super stand up people. The service is always great, wine selection pretty darn good and they make a mean dirty martini, the menu selection is great but meal quality can be spotty. I always order crab cakes for appetizers, but the last few visits have produced a soggy batch or two. 

The interior needs a refresh, but I'll take a friendly welcome from a local over some cookie cutter restaurant any day!

data.title: Classic Bakersfield
data.text: First off, best stuffed mushrooms out there! Stuffed bleu cheese filet is very tender and always cooked perfectly. Great service and just good times all around.

data.title: Best Wine Selection and Steak in B-town
data.text: My wife and I spent 10 years in Southern California and when we moved to Bakersfield we were afraid that we left our days of eating at excellent restaurants behind.  We were pleasantly surprised by a recent visit to TL Maxwells. The steaks were top-notch and the wine list was extensive and perfectly paired with menu.

data.title: Just ok!
data.text: My husband and I were refered here to celebrate our anniversary. The reviews made it sound great. We were underwelmed. The crab cakes were aweful, little burnt edged flat things with mustard on top.? Very strange. My gargonzola topped filet was drenched in wine reduction sauce and not a great cut. My rice was good but covered in the sauce so I just ate most off the top. My husband ordered the chicken and lobster which was great but again drenched in so much sauce. Our server only visited the table to take our order and give us our bill, otherwise we had about five other people help us. No one ever offered a drink refill. The female server that was helping nearby tables was great with them and very attentive to her customers, our guy wasn't.  Seems like a bit of a hit and miss place. Although not horrible,  we wont be back.

data.title: Best Fine Dining in Bakersfield - By Far
data.text:
I've had meals all over the US, on the Left Bank in Paris, all over Europe, and on a few islands in the Pacific - and I have to say, T L Maxwell's food definitely holds its own against some of the world's finest dining.

We went there for my birthday and everyone was ecstatic over what they ordered.  Yes, it's a bit pricey ($100+ for 3 people), but once in awhile, when you want to treat yourself or others, it is definitely worth it.

The atmosphere is casual, romantic - and dark.  But once you get in there and get seated, your eyes adjust and it wasn't bad at all.  Besides, everyone looks just a little better in low light.

Service was perfect (mid-week, there weren't many people there).  I highly recommend you plan for this culinary treat - and go!  Just go!

data.title: Nice Place to Celebrate
data.text: The food and service here are always excellent. It is the place to go if you are celebraing anniversaries, birthdays orjust want to treat yourself to a great meal with white linen and pleasant ambiance. W have eaten ther several times over the last several years.

data.title: Great Food and Great Service
data.text: We had the opportunity to visit this restaurant last evening in Downtown Bakersfield.  Their location is a little interesting but we found it and it was a delight.  Their were four of us and we order the specials of Filet Mignon with blue cheese stuffing, the Orange Roughy and the third item was the Louisiana Pork Chop.  The fillets were large and one of the best tasting that we have had.  The pork chops were the right mix of sweet and spicy and the orange roughy was cooked to perfection.  The evening was enhanced with a knowledgeable and efficient waitress which brought on a great evening. They also had a wonderful clam chowder.  If you get the chance to stop in to this quaint restaurant, I would recommend it!

data.title: Oh No - I don't think so.
data.text: We were invited here by friends and all of us were anxious to try this long established, well reputed restaurant.  It is located in an alley in downtown Bakersfield.  While getting out of our car we were approached by a homeless panhandler.  When returning to our car, we had to walk around 3 people who were diving in the restaurant 's dumpster.  Not exactly our idea of a special night out.  Anyhow, to the restaurant itself - it is very old, out of date and shabby.  It may appeal to some who are going down Memory Lane - not to us.  The food - my husband ordered the blue cheese stuffed steak which was grisly and smothered with a heavy sauce - he couldn't  eat it.  When I ordered my Shrimp Caesar salad - the waitress asked what kind of dressing did I want??  Caesar, please.  To be fair, my salad was fine.  The waitress was a tad over familiar for our liking but that seemed to go with the whole atmosphere and is probably how the owner likes the staff to be.  The bar was deserted - just one patron.  We all thought it was pretty expensive.  Won't return - didn't feel safe in the area at night and were pleasantly surprised to find the wheels still on our car when we returned to it.
